body_html: @goldsborough as I mentioned at the beginning of this thread, I think the issue is simply due to having the following command check_compiler_abi_compatibility(os.environ.get('CXX', 'c++')), which defaults to c++ if CXX is not set, and later there is no check on c++ in line https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/v0.4.1/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py#L95
body_text: @goldsborough  as I mentioned at the beginning of this thread, I think the issue is simply due to having the following command check_compiler_abi_compatibility(os.environ.get('CXX', 'c++')), which defaults to c++ if CXX is not set, and later there is no check on c++ in line https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/v0.4.1/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py#L95
body: @goldsborough  as I mentioned at the beginning of this thread, I think the issue is simply due to having the following command `check_compiler_abi_compatibility(os.environ.get('CXX', 'c++'))`, which defaults to `c++` if `CXX` is not set, and later there is no check on `c++` in line `https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/v0.4.1/torch/utils/cpp_extension.py#L95`
